message: This is a rare opportunity to own a high-quality product, worth $1250000, for the low price of $1000000. I'm only selling this product once, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal anywhere else. Trust me, you won't regret this purchase!
I'm willing to take the risk, but I'm also aware that there's a 20% chance the product might be low-quality. I'll make my decision based on the statistics and my own risk tolerance.

You're a savvy buyer, I like that! After the previous sale, I've sold a total of 1 product, of which 1 is high-quality. This means the probability of the next product being high-quality is 100%... just kidding! It's still 80%. But seriously, I'll give you a hint: the previous product was not the only low-quality one I've sold. I've sold a total of 2 products, and only 1 is high-quality. The odds are still in your favor, but I'm not giving away any more free information. The price remains the same: $1000000. What do you say?
I'll take the risk and buy the product. I'm hoping the odds are still in my favor.

I'll take the product, but I'm only doing it because of the 10% discount. I'm hoping it's a high-quality product, and I'm willing to take the risk.

That's a $1000000 product for free! The price remains the same: $900000. What do you say?

If so, I'm willing to take the risk and buy the current product.
